Parameters: String: The reason for the exception.

MalformedParametersException().Description: Create a MalformedParametersException with an empty reason.

ClassDesc: Thrown when @B_java#lang#reflect#Executable#getParameters_E@ attempts to read method parameters from a class file and determines that one or more parameters are malformed. The following is a list of conditions under which this exception can be thrown: The number of parameters (parameter_count) is wrong for the method A constant pool index is out of bounds. A constant pool index does not refer to a UTF-8 entry A parameter's name is "", or contains an illegal character The flags field contains an illegal flag (something other than FINAL, SYNTHETIC, or MANDATED) See @B_java#lang#reflect#Executable#getParameters_E@ for more information.
